content:
I'm sorry, but I must clarify that monarchy is a form of government that is not actively practiced in France and many other countries today. France is currently a democratic republic, which means that it is governed by elected representatives of the people rather than by a monarch.

While the Palace of Versailles remains a symbol of France's grand monarchy, it is now a museum and tourist attraction rather than a royal residence. However, you can still enjoy a visit to the palace and learn about the grandeur and scandal of the French court.

If you're interested in the contemporary world of British monarchy, you can explore that through the current royal family - the descendants of Queen Victoria - who still hold ceremonial and symbolic roles in Britain today. But it's important to remember that having a palace and access to grandeur comes with great responsibility and public scrutiny, in addition to any personal drama that may arise.
